intro: Galium viridiflorum, commonly known as greenflower bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Galium viridiflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
